ase-cloudSCTActivityData.description: Cutomer query productCode:sct can get "Trend Cloud One - AWS CloudTrail Integration" Activity Data, For more information, please see the data mapping file at [https://github.com/trendmicro/tm-v1-schema/blob/master/doc/Cloud%20Activity%20Data.yaml](https://github.com/trendmicro/tm-v1-schema/blob/master/doc/Cloud%20Activity%20Data.yaml).

eventTimeDT.description: The date and time the request was made, in coordinated universal time (UTC).

awsRegion.description: The AWS region that the request was made to, such as us-east-2.

eventCategory.description: Shows the event category that is used in LookupEvents calls. For management events, the value is Management. For data events, the value is Data. For Insights events, the value is Insight.

eventID.description: GUID generated by CloudTrail to uniquely identify each event. You can use this value to identify a single event. For example, you can use the ID as a primary key to retrieve log data from a searchable database.

eventName.description: The requested action, which is one of the actions in the API for that service.

eventSource.description: The service that the request was made to. This name is typically a short form of the service name without spaces plus .amazonaws.com. For example: AWS CloudFormation is cloudformation.amazonaws.com. Amazon EC2 is ec2.amazonaws.com. Amazon Simple Workflow Service is swf.amazonaws.com. This convention has some exceptions. For example, the eventSource for Amazon CloudWatch is monitoring.amazonaws.com.

eventTime.description: The date and time the request was made, in coordinated universal time (UTC).

eventType.description: Identifies the type of event that generated the event record. This can be the one of the following values: AwsApiCall - An API was called. AwsServiceEvent - The service generated an event related to your trail. For example, this can occur when another account made a call with a resource that you own. AwsConsoleAction - An action was taken in the console that was not an API call. AwsConsoleSignIn - A user in your account (root, IAM, federated, SAML, or SwitchRole) signed in to the AWS Management Console. AwsCloudTrailInsight - If Insights events are enabled for the trail, CloudTrail generates Insights events when CloudTrail detects unusual operational activity such as spikes in resource provisioning or bursts of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) actions

eventVersion.description: The version of the log event format

managementEvent.description: A Boolean value that identifies whether the event is a management event

readOnly.description: Identifies whether this operation is a read-only operation.

requestID.description: Represents the account ID that received this event.

sourceIPAddress.description: The IP address that the request was made from.

userAgent.description: The agent through which the request was made, such as the AWS Management Console

ingestedStartDateTime.description:
The UTC timestamp of the log collection start time in ISO 8601 format.

if period is 24h, ingestedStartDateTime will be the time with hour-level precision within last 24 hours like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:00:00.000Z" , for example, 2023-03-01T12:00:00.000Z.

if period is 7d or 30d, ingestedStartDateTime will be the time with day-level precision within last 7/30 days. This time represents 00:00:00 every day in the past 7/30 days.

eventTimeDT.description: The date and time the request was made, in coordinated universal time (UTC).

awsRegion.description: The AWS region to which the request was sent.

eventCategory.description:
The category of an event.

Available values:
- `Management`
- `Data`
- `Insights`

eventID.description:
The ID of each event.

CloudTrail generates this value.

eventName.description: The requested action, which is one of the actions in the API for that service.

eventSource.description: The service to which the request was sent

eventTime.description: The date and time the request was made, in coordinated universal time (UTC).

eventType.description:
The type of event that generated the record.

Available values:

|Event|Description|
|------|------------|
|`AwsApiCall`|A call to an API.|
|`AwsServiceEvent`|The service generated an event related to your trail. This can happen when another account made a call with a resource you own.|
|`AwsConsoleAction`|An action performed from your console.|
|`AwsConsoleSignIn`|A user in your organization (root, IAM, federated, SAML, or SwitchRole) signed into the AWS management console.|
|`AwsCloudTrailInsight`|An event generated by CloudTrail Insights|

arp-taskStatus.description:
The status of the command sent to the managing server. 

Possible task statuses:
- `queued `: The managing server queued the command because the agent was offline or due to a high volume of requests.
- `running`: Trend Vision One sent the command to the managing server and is waiting for a response
- `succeeded`: The managing server successfully received the command
- `failed`: An error or time-out occurred when attempting to send the command to the managing server
- `canceled`: The task was manually terminated
- `pendingApproval`: The task is pending approval from specified users
- `rejected`: The task was rejected

reportUpdatedDateTime.description:
The timestamp indicating the last update time of the report included in the current response. This field is represented in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2023-01-13T10:15:30Z).
If the `nextLink` property is provided, use it to retrieve the next batch of STIX objects for this query session.
Additionally, the value of `reportUpdatedDateTime` can be used as the `startDateTime` parameter in the next query session to ensure continuity in the retrieval process.

nextLink.description: The link to retrieve the next batch of STIX objects in paginated output which contains a skipToken.

reportUpdatedDateTime.description:
The timestamp indicating the last update time of the report included in the current response. This field is represented in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2023-01-13T10:15:30Z).
If the `nextLink` property is provided, use it to retrieve the next batch of STIX objects for this query session.
Additionally, the value of `reportUpdatedDateTime` can be used as the `startDateTime` parameter in the next query session to ensure continuity in the retrieval process.

cveId.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures identifier (CVE ID)

cveRiskLevel.description: The risk level of the risk event triggered by a CVE

cveRiskScore.description:
The risk score of the risk event triggered by a CVE.

The risk score takes into consideration the CVSS score and factors such as the availability of exploits, and the existence of patches.

cvssScore.description:
A number from 1 to 10 that rates the severity of security vulnerabilities.

CVSS scores are calculated using metrics defined by the Forum of Incident Response and Security Teams (FIRST)

affectedSoftwares.description: The software components affected by the vulnerability

affectedAssetCount.description: The number of assets affected by the CVE

exploitAttemptsCount.description: The number of times attackers have attempted to exploit the vulnerability in your environment

globalExploitActivityLevel.description:
Indicates how often attackers are exploiting a vulnerability

> **Important**
>
> - `high` corresponds to "Actively exploited" in the Trend Vision One console.
> - `medium` corresponds to "High" in the Trend Vision One console.

name.description: The name of the prevention rule.

cveId.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures identifier (CVE ID)

cveRiskLevel.description: The risk level of the risk event triggered by a CVE

cveRiskScore.description:
The risk score of the risk event triggered by a CVE.

The risk score takes into consideration the CVSS score and factors such as the availability of exploits, and the existence of patches.

cvssScore.description:
A number from 1 to 10 that rates the severity of security vulnerabilities.

CVSS scores are calculated using metrics defined by the Forum of Incident Response and Security Teams (FIRST).

affectedFunctionCount.description: The number of serverless functions that are affected by the CVE

affectedLayerCount.description: The number of application layers affected or associated with the CVE

globalExploitActivityLevel.description:
Indicates how often attackers are exploiting a vulnerability

> **Important**
>
> - `high` corresponds to "Actively exploited" in the Trend Vision One console.
> - `medium` corresponds to "High" in the Trend Vision One console.

firstSeenDateTime.description: The date the CVE was first detected in your environment, in ISO 8601 format

publishedDateTime.description: The date MITRE published the CVE, in ISO 8601 format

preventionRules.description: The prevention rules associated with the CVE

id.description: The ID of the prevention rule.

cam-innerErrorResponse.description: An object representing an internal server error response.

code.description:
The error code and description.

Available values:
- `invalid-feature`: The requested feature does not exist.
- `assume-identity-failed`: The identity provided in the request cannot be assumed. This typically indicates an issue with the customer's deployment.
- `invalid-request-header`: Some of the request headers are either missing or invalid.
- `invalid-request-body`: The structure of the request body is invalid and does not match the expected format.
- `invalid-parameter`: Some of the request parameters are either missing or invalid.
- `missing-role-tag`: The role associated with the provided `roleArn` does not have the 'VisionOneCloudFormationStackName' role tag.

To obtain custom tags, refer to the following URL: https://automation.trendmicro.com/xdr/api-v3/#tag/Attack-Surface-Discovery/paths/~1v3.0~1asrm~1attackSurfaceCustomTags/get. However, platform tags will be provided through an additional API in the future. The difference between custom tags and platform tags is that properties of platform tags are defined by Trend Micro, while properties and values of custom tags can be created and updated by users.

The rule for capabilities that you want to enforce
- "baseline" restricts containers with the NET_RAW capability or any non-default capability
- "restricted" restricts containers with any capability other than the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability
- "restrict-nondefaults" restricts containers with any capability that are not already given by Docker by default
- "restrict-all" restricts containers with any capability

The categories of the exception.

Different benchmark versions might have different exception categories. To get the list of supported exception categories for a specific benchmark version, make a GET request to the `/complianceScanConfiguration` endpoint.

Supported values for Kubernetes benchmark version 1.9.0: 
- `cluster_admin_role`
- `secrets_access`
- `role_wildcards`
- `pods_creation_access`
- `restrict_default_service_accounts`

location.description:
List of supported geographical locations for filtering the Trend Threat Intelligence Feed.
These locations are associated with threat reports and can be used to refine search results via the `TMV1-Contextual-Filter` parameter in the `/v3.0/threatintel/feeds` API.

industry.description:
List of supported industries for filtering the Trend Threat Intelligence Feed.
These represent business sectors referenced in threat reports and can be specified using the `TMV1-Contextual-Filter` parameter in the `/v3.0/threatintel/feeds` API.

ase-startDateTime.name: startDateTime
ase-startDateTime.description: The start of the data retrieval range in ISO 8601 format. Default:startDateTime defaults to 24 hours before the request is made.

ase-endDateTime.name: endDateTime
ase-endDateTime.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format that indicates the end of the data retrieval time range. If no value is specified, 'endDateTime' defaults to the time the request is made.

ase-top.name: top
ase-top.description: The number of records displayed on a page in default mode.

ase-mode.name: mode
ase-mode.description:
The type of data returned by the query results ("default" displays all data returned by the query, "countOnly" displays the number of records returned, and "performance" limits the returned records to 500.):
* 'default' - Displays the data returned by the query
* 'countOnly' - Displays the number of records returned by the query
* 'performance' - 'performance' - Displays the data in performance mode, but the "top" parameter does not work and there may be zero records returned even though progressRate has not reached 100. To display all records, call the API again via nextLink until progressRate has reached 100. Use count mode to avoid returning empty data.

cam-aws-tmv1-filter.name: TMV1-Filter
cam-aws-tmv1-filter.description:
The filter for retrieving a list of a subset of connected AWS accounts.

Supported fields:
|Field  |Description |Supported values|
|---------|---------|---------|
|name|The name of the AWS account.|Any value|
|state|The state of the AWS account.|`managed`, `outdated`, `failed`|
|featureId|The features enabled for the AWS account.|`container-security`, `cloud-response`|
|id|The ID of the AWS account.|Any value|

Supported operators:
|Operator  |Description  |
|---------|---------|
|`eq`|Operator 'equal to'|
|`and`|Operator 'and'|
|`or`|Operator 'or'|
|`not`|Operator 'not'|
|`( )`|Symbols for grouping operands with their correct operator.|
|`contains`|Operator that allows you to search for a specified string in a field|

Note: Include this parameter in every request that generates paginated output.

conditionExpress1.summary: List AWS accounts with states of 'managed' or 'outdated'.

conditionExpress2.summary: List managed AWS accounts with names containing 'lab' or IDs containing '123'.

cam-gcp-tmv1-filter-v3.name: TMV1-Filter
cam-gcp-tmv1-filter-v3.description:
The filter for retrieving a list of a subset of connected Google Cloud projects.

Supported fields:
|Field  |Description |Possible values
|---------|---------|---------|
|id| The Google Cloud project number used as the ID for managing the connected Google Cloud project in Cloud Accounts.|Any value|
|name| The name of the Google Cloud project. |Any value|
|state| The status of the Google Cloud project. |`managed`, `outdated`, `failed`|
|workloadIdentityPoolId| The workload identity pool ID of the Google Cloud project. |Any value|
|oidcProviderId| The OIDC provider ID of the Google Cloud project. |Any value|
|serviceAccountId| The service account ID of the Google Cloud project. |Any value|
|featureId| The features enabled for the Google Cloud project. |`cloud-sentry`|
|gcpRegion| The region where Cloud Accounts is deployed. |Any supported region value|
Supported operators:
|Operator  |Description  |
|---------|---------|
|`eq`|Operator 'equal to'|
|`and`|Operator 'and'|
|`or`|Operator 'or'|
|`not`|Operator 'not'|
|`( )`|Symbols for grouping operands with their correct operator.|
|`contains`|Operator that allows you to search for a specified string in a field|

Note: Include this parameter in every request that generates paginated output.

conditionExpress1.summary: List Google Cloud projects with statuses of 'managed' or 'outdated'.

conditionExpress2.summary: List managed Google Cloud projects with names containing 'lab' or IDs containing '123'.

cam-gcpProjectNumber.name: id
cam-gcpProjectNumber.description: The GCP project number Cloud Account Management uses for managing the connected GCP project.

|`contains`|Operator that allows you to search for a specified string in a field|

Note: Include this parameter in every request that generates paginated output.
